item.description:
Stratford Regional Planning Commission is holding a public meeting to discuss if they should sign us onto the Granite State Futures plan.  This meeting will be open to public discussion and comment (3 minutes) for each citizen that wishes to address the commission.  I ask all to come and to be polite and offer up good arguments why they should not sign this contract.  This is an important meeting to turn this plan back and help other communities to use us for their example.  Rochester has already turned it down.  There will be around  20-25 RPC commissioners in attendance so your views are important to share. Please invite others to speak, you will be required to fill out a card stating your intention to speak.  They may make a few laps around the room allowing second comments I'm not sure on this but we will be speaking after the Granite State Futures presentation.

Semper Fi,

Jerry
item.name: Agenda 21/Granite State Futures Meeting
